description:
TORILX

The National Weather Service in Lincoln has issued a

* THIS IS A TEST MESSAGE. This is a TEST Tornado Warning for...
  Sangamon County in central Illinois...

* THIS IS A TEST MESSAGE. Until 615 PM CDT.

* THIS IS A TEST MESSAGE. At 600 PM CDT...This is only a test.
  Please disregard this message. There is no tornado.

  HAZARD...No severe weather was occurring or expected.

  SOURCE...This is a test.

  IMPACT...In a real tornado flying debris will be dangerous to 
           those caugt without shelter. Even well built homes may 
           suffer significant damage. This is a test.

* THIS IS A TEST MESSAGE. Locations impacted include...
  Springfield, Mechanicsburg, Chatham, Auburn and Loami.
instruction:
THIS IS A TEST MESSAGE. Had there been an actual tornado, you would
have been given instructions on how to protect life.

NWSHeadline: THIS MESSAGE IS FOR TEST PURPOSES ONLY

description:
FFWILX

The National Weather Service in Lincoln has issued a

* THIS IS A TEST MESSAGE. This is a TEST Flash Flood Warning for...
  Sangamon County in central Illinois...

* Until 630 PM CDT.

* At 600 PM CDT...This is only a test. Please disregard this
  message. There is no flash flooding occurring at this time.

  HAZARD...No flash flooding was occurring or expected.
  
  SOURCE...This is a test.
  
  IMPACT...In a real flash flood, flooding occurs mainly in poor
           drainage and low-lying areas.
           
* THIS IS A TEST MESSAGE. Locations impacted include...
  Springfield, Mechanicsburg, Chatham, Auburn and Loami.
instruction:
THIS IS A TEST MESSAGE. If there was a real flash flood, you would
have been told to avoid flooded roadways. You might also have been
told to seek higher ground, or evacuate if such action was
necessary.

NWSheadline: THIS MESSAGE IS FOR TEST PURPOSES ONLY

areaDesc: Grant, MN; Otter Tail, MN; Wilkin, MN
headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 4 at 10:57AM CST until December 4 at 11:45AM CST by NWS Grand Forks ND
description:
The National Weather Service in Grand Forks has issued a

* Snow Squall Warning for...
Southern Otter Tail County in west central Minnesota...
Grant County in west central Minnesota...
Southern Wilkin County in west central Minnesota...

* Until 1145 AM CST.

* At 1057 AM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line
extending from Brushvale to near Fergus Falls to near Henning,
moving south at 40 mph.

HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to
blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than
one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 40 mph.

SOURCE...Radar and webcams.

IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are
expected to develop rapidly in the warning area.

This includes Interstate 94 in Minnesota between mile markers 55 and
80.

Locations impacted include...
Fergus Falls, Wahpeton, Breckenridge, southwestern Ottertail Lake,
Elbow Lake, Parkers Prairie, and Battle Lake.
instruction:
Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are
expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden
whiteout conditions.

Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the
visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.

NWSHeadline: THIS MESSAGE HAS BEEN REPURPOSED TO BE USE AS A TEST. NO ACTION IS NEEDED
CMAMtext: Snow Squall Warning til 11:45 AM CST. Sudden whiteouts. Icy roads. Slow down! -NWS
CMAMlongtext: National Weather Service: Snow Squall Warning until 11:45 AM CST. Slow down or delay travel! Be ready for a sudden drop to near zero visibility and icy roads in heavy snow.

areaDesc: San Pablo Bay, Suisun Bay, the West Delta and  the San Francisco Bay north of the Bay Bridge; San Francisco Bay South of the Bay Bridge; San Francisco; Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; North Bay Interior Valleys; San Francisco Bay Shoreline; San Francisco Peninsula Coast; Mendocino Coast; Southwestern Humboldt; Northern Humboldt Coast; Coastal Del Norte; South Central Oregon Coast; Curry County Coast
headline: Tsunami Warning issued December 5 at 11:24AM PST by NWS National Tsunami Warning Center
description:
In the event a Tsunami Warning is issued for your area, move inland
to higher ground.

Tsunami warnings mean that a tsunami with significant
inundation is possible or is already occurring.  Tsunamis are
a series of waves dangerous many hours after initial arrival
time.  The first wave may not be the largest.

The tsunami warning will remain in effect until further notice.
Refer to the internet site tsunami.gov for more information.

NWSheadline: THIS MESSAGE IS FOR TEST PURPOSES ONLY
